name: FloorConstruction
title: Floor Construction
description: Floor Construction codes for insurance operations.

concept.display: Poured Concrete or Fire resistive material
concept.definition: Floor constructed with poured concrete or materials specifically designed to resist fire and heat transmission.

designation.value: Béton coulé ou matériaux résistants au feu
Concreto vertido o material resistente al fuego

concept.definition: Steel structural floor system incorporating masonry components, providing non-combustible construction.
Steel structural floor system without masonry components, using only non-combustible materials.
Floor constructed primarily with brick, stone, concrete block, or similar masonry units.

concept.display: Masonry on wood structure or other combustible material
concept.definition: Masonry floor finish or covering laid over a wood or other combustible structural frame.

designation.value: Maçonnerie sur structure de bois ou autres matériaux inflammables
Mampostería sobre estructura de madera u otro material combustible

concept.definition: Floor constructed with wood framing members such as joists, beams, and subflooring.
Floor construction type not categorized in standard classifications.
Precast or pre-stressed concrete panels supported by a steel structural frame.

designation.value: Panneaux de béton sur structure d'acier
Paneles de concreto sobre estructura de acero

concept.definition: Floor constructed entirely with steel components including beams, decking, and structural supports.
Floor constructed with large dimensional lumber beams, commonly found in older industrial mill buildings.
Floor constructed with wood materials including planks, beams, or engineered wood products.
Floor constructed with brick or natural stone materials, typically laid in mortar.
Floor system combining multiple materials such as concrete and steel to create an integrated structural system.
